intro: Scaphyglottis antonii, commonly known as the Antón's scaphyglottis, is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is a terrestrial herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and produces showy, fragrant flowers with a distinctive spurred lip. Its leaves are typically lanceolate and arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
